newsitem.title: POLAND: Espebepe plans up to 2.2 mln share issue.
newsitem.headline: Espebepe plans up to 2.2 mln share issue.

text.p: Ailing Polish construction company Espebepe SA wants its shareholders to vote on May 31 on a new share issue of up to 2,219,828 shares ex-rights for its creditors, the company said in a statement on Friday.
Espebepe said the new, registered shares, would be offered to its creditors in return for an 11.1-million-zloty-debt, which was not planned to be written off.
It said creditors who wanted to take part in the debt-for- equity scheme should demand so by June 30.
Last week Espebepe, which has about 75 million zlotys of debts, won approval from its largest creditors for a write off of 80 percent of the debts and smaller creditors to write off 20 percent.
It earlier said that it would like to offer its creditors new shares, priced at par value of five zlotys per share. But on Friday it said the issue price would be set later by the supervisory board.
